amendment.description: To express the sense of the Senate that the United States faces continuing threats from terrorist groups operating in Syria and Afghanistan and that the precipitous withdrawal of United States forces from either country could put at risk hard-won gains and United States national security.

vote.text: Amendment SA 65, as amended, agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 70 - 26. Record Vote Number: 14.

action.text: Cloture on amendment SA 65 invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 68 - 23. Record Vote Number: 13.
Cloture motion on amendment SA 65 presented in Senate.

Amendment SA 65 proposed by Senator McConnell. (consideration: CR S732-733; text: CR S732-733) To express the sense of the Senate that the United States faces continuing threats from terrorist groups operating in Syria and Afghanistan and that the precipitous withdrawal of United States forces from either country could put at risk hard-won gains and United States national security.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 65, as amended, agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 70 - 26. Record Vote Number: 14.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 65, as amended, agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 70 - 26. Record Vote Number: 14.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Cloture on amendment SA 65 invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 68 - 23. Record Vote Number: 13.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 65 proposed by Senator McConnell.
